feat:property.name: SingleSignOn
feat:property.feat:description: Use a Single Sign, overrides value for authentication method

feat:pValue.feat:displayValue: Do not use Single Sign On

feat:property.name: AuthenticationMethod.X509.Keystore.View
feat:property.feat:description: Keystore/PSE for X.509 certificate used for authentication

feat:property.name: IncludeTimestamp
feat:property.feat:description: Timestamps are used for incoming (required) and outgoing messages

feat:property.name: AlgorithmSuite
feat:property.feat:description: Algorithm suite that is used for cryptographic operations

feat:property.name: SecurityMechanism
feat:property.feat:description: Security Mechanism (Document Security or HTTP Security)

feat:property.name: OutgoingSignature
feat:property.feat:description: Indicates whether message needs to be signed

feat:property.name: OutgoingEncryption
feat:property.feat:description: Indicates whether the message is to be encrypted

feat:property.name: IncomingMessageAge.Age
feat:property.feat:description: Maximum age of messages that are still processed

feat:property.name: SOAPErrorBehavior.ApplySecuritySettingsFor
feat:property.feat:description: Security configuration used for SOAP faults

feat:property.name: SecureConversation
feat:property.feat:description: A protocol providing Signature and Encryption using dynamically generated keys negotiated by the involved systems

feat:property.name: SecureCommunicationOnly
feat:property.feat:description: Allows transport protocol only https or secure conversation over http

feat:property.name: SessionMethod
feat:property.feat:description: Mechanism for realization of stateful sessions

feat:property.name: enableSession
feat:property.feat:description: This property defines, if a stateful communication for a Web Service call is performed, i.e. if the inner status on the provider side is kept over multiple calls.

feat:property.name: AckInterval
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies a time interval for sending separate receipt confirmations

feat:property.name: ExponentialBackoff
feat:property.feat:description: Exponential backoff mechanism configuration for retransmission of the messages

feat:property.name: RetransmissionInterval
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies the interval for retransmission of a message in milliseconds

feat:property.name: InactivityTimeout
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies some time interval within the termination of a sequence will not be performed

feat:property.name: SequenceLifetime
feat:property.feat:displayName: Lifetime in milliseconds of a sequence
feat:property.feat:description: Describes the lifetime of a message sequence

feat:feature.name: http://www.sap.com/webas/710/service/metering/
feat:feature.feat:description: Controlling the transfer of caller information for metering of service calls on provider side.

feat:property.name: Level
feat:property.feat:description: Determines the extent of data to be transferred to the service provisioning side for logging the service calls.

feat:property.name: Protocol
feat:property.feat:description: Transfer protocol for service consumer data to provider.

feat:feature.name: http://www.sap.com/710/soap/features/WSAddressing/
feat:feature.feat:description: Send Web service address in SOAP header

feat:feature.name: http://www.sap.com/webas/710/soap/features/massconfig/setup
feat:feature.feat:description: When a service provider is convigured via the mass configuration framework, several bindings are created, each of them is preconfigured with the several setup properties before it is passed through the DTRT Mapping rules. According to different setup properties in the binding, different runtime properties are going to be added in the binding during the DTRT Mapping process.

feat:property.name: SecurityMechanism
feat:property.feat:description: Setup Parameter for document or transport security mechanism

feat:property.name: EnableSecureConversation
feat:property.feat:description: Setup Parameter to enable secure conversation

feat:feature.name: http://www.sap.com/webas/710/soap/features/transportbinding/
feat:feature.feat:description: Technical Configuration for HTTP Message Exchange

feat:property.name: keepAliveStatus
feat:property.feat:description: Sets in the request Connection:keepAlive http header in order one and same connection to be used by multiple request-response cycles

feat:property.name: compressResponse
feat:property.feat:description: By including Accept-Encoding: gzip http request header the client notifies the server that it could handle gzip-compressed responses

feat:property.name: socketTimeout
feat:property.feat:displayName: Max wait-time for http response (in milliseconds)
feat:property.feat:description: Once the client has committed the request to the server it starts waiting for server’s response. This property determines for how long the client should wait for the response before throwing an error.

feat:property.name: URLProtocol
feat:property.feat:displayName: Optional protocol information for access URL
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies the protocol to be used for accessing a Web Service

feat:property.name: ProxyHost
feat:property.feat:description: If a proxy gets used for the HTTP connections on client side, then its host name is specifed here.

feat:property.name: ProxyPort
feat:property.feat:description: If a proxy gets used for the HTTP connections on client side, then the port number of the proxy process is specifed here.

feat:property.name: ProxyUser
feat:property.feat:description: If a proxy gets used for the HTTP connections on client side, then the user name needed for the proxy access is specifed here.

feat:property.name: ProxyPassword
feat:property.feat:displayName: Password of user for proxy access
feat:property.feat:description: If a proxy gets used for the HTTP connections on client side, then the user’s password needed for the proxy access is specifed here.

feat:property.name: chunkedRequest
feat:property.feat:description: : Issue chunked http requests against the server

feat:property.name: altHost
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies the host name used on the WS side for WSDL document generation

feat:property.name: altPort
feat:property.feat:description: Specifies the port number used on the WS side for WSDL document generation

feat:property.name: Idempotency.Retry.Sleep.RT
feat:property.feat:description: Defines the period after which retry is triggered

feat:property.name: XI.XITransportIsPossible.DT
feat:property.feat:description: This property defines, if a XI messaging transport is possible.
